node.title: Celebrity cosmetic surgeon's liposuction patient in ICU after 'life-threatening' blood loss
node.alt: A man wearing a surgeon's scrubs, mask and a hate with his name embroidered looks directly into the camera.
node.description: The woman is on a ventilator in a Sydney hospital after undergoing a procedure performed by famous cosmetic surgeon Daniel Aronov.
node.content:
["A woman who underwent liposuction from an associate of controversial cosmetic surgeon Daniel Lanzer has been taken to hospital in a critical condition with significant blood loss.", "The 42-year-old was found unconscious by her husband on Tuesday morning.", "She is currently on a ventilator in the intensive care unit of Sydney's St Vincent's Hospital in a serious but stable condition.", "When she was admitted to the emergency department her haemoglobin levels were at 54 and pH 6.8, which indicated \"significant and major blood loss that was a life-threatening time-critical emergency\", according to plastic surgeon\u00a0Mark Ashton.", "The doctor who did her liposuction procedure is Daniel Aronov.", "He is an associate at Dr Lanzer's clinics which have been the subject of intense scrutiny in the wake of a joint Four Corners investigation with the Sydney Morning Herald and The Age.", "Following the Four Corners program, Dr Lanzer gave a legally enforceable undertaking to stop practising medicine in Australia, which the national regulator, the Australian Health Practitioner Regulation Agency (AHPRA), said would remain in place until it completed\u00a0its investigation.", "Dr Lanzer has said he does\u00a0not think there is another surgeon in the world who can show a better safety record than him, and has described the Four Corners report as \"spurious\", \"unfair\" and \"misinformation\".", "The Four Corners report did not raise any concerns about Dr Aronov.", "", "
Daniel Lanzer and Daniel Aronov on Dr Lanzer's Channel Seven TV show.(Source: The Cosmetic Surgery Show/Seven Network)
", "In a statement, Dr Aronov described this week's\u00a0incident as \"serious\".", "\"This was a serious incident and is the first time any of my patients have required hospitalisation as a result of a complication,\" he said.", "\"While all patients are warned of the risks of significant complications multiple times, this does not detract from the distress experienced by this patient and her family.", "\"As soon as I was made aware of the patient's deterioration, without hesitation I recommended an ambulance be called immediately, and then personally attended to assess the situation and assist the paramedics. I have been liaising with her treating team throughout her recovery.\"", "Dr Aronov is also currently being investigated by AHPRA in relation to another patient who underwent liposuction.", "The latest medical emergency comes just days after it was revealed Dr Aronov had filmed a mock re-enactment of a separate medical emergency in which another patient, Suzanne Steward, was taken to hospital.", "Ms Steward ended up in intensive care earlier this year with a collapsed lung and other complications after a liposuction procedure at Dr Lanzer's Melbourne clinic.", "Dr Aronov said he had no involvement in her liposuction procedure.", "Ms Steward did not see the humour in Dr Aronov's video.", "\"Does he think it's funny? I'd like to see it happen to him,\" she said.", "", "
Suzanne Steward needed a blood transfusion after a procedure at Dr Lanzer's Melbourne clinic.(The Age: Eddie Jim)
", "\"You don't make a joke about something like that \u2026 No, you're disgusting.\"", "In a statement, Dr Aronov said he was not mocking the patient, but rather it was a \"self-mocking\" video \"aimed at boosting staff morale\".", "Dr Aronov was the most followed cosmetic surgeon in the world on TikTok, with 13.4 million followers but his account has been silent since the Four Corners investigation with The Age and Sydney Morning Herald went to air in late October and was suddenly closed earlier this week.", "He has also closed down his Instagram account that contained videos of patients being operated on, hundreds of photos of near-nude women and \"okay or not okay\" videos where he posed questions to his hundreds of thousands of followers about whether he should use music with graphic and offensive language.", "Calls to Dr Lanzer's Sydney clinic were bounced to a call centre which advised that Dr Aronov was fully booked for the rest of the year.", "
Another complaint to AHPRA dismissed
", "There is also mounting pressure on the medical regulator,\u00a0AHPRA, after another former patient revealed AHPRA had dismissed his complaint about Dr Aronov and Dr Lanzer last year following a three-month investigation.", "The patient \u2013 who wanted\u00a0to be known as Thomas \u2013 had gynecomastia, or \"man boob\" surgery with Dr Aronov at Dr Lanzer's Brisbane clinic in July 2019.", "", "
Thomas before (left) and after (right) the surgery.(Supplied by patient)
", "Thomas said the operation left him without the confidence to even go swimming without a shirt.", "\"My gynecomastia operation was extremely brutal and painful,\" he said.", "Thomas said he had been told he would\u00a0only need three days off work but ended up taking six weeks off because he was in so much pain.", "He said the pain lasted for six months and, more than two years later, still has not completely disappeared.", "He is still unhappy with the appearance of his chest.", "\"I came into surgery with two normal breasts, with normal shaped nipples and areolas.\u00a0The only issue I had was with my excess breast tissue \u2026\u00a0I am now left with deformed breasts, with creasing on both breasts and abnormally sized nipples.\"", "", "
Thomas's chest six months after surgery.(Supplied by patient)
", "In July 2020, Thomas made a complaint to AHPRA about both Dr Aronov and Dr Lanzer.", "Three months later, AHPRA informed him it had decided to take no further action.", "\"We made a permanent record of your concerns about the practitioners on our database. We have advised Dr Daniel Lanzer and Dr Daniel Aronov about the concerns that you raised,\" it said.", "\"The Board takes other information into account, including: information about where and how the practitioners practise; and historical information about the practitioners. Based on all of this information, the Board believes it was not possible to conclude that the practitioners are practising unsafely.\"", "In a statement, Dr Aronov said Thomas was warned twice before the operation that he would not get a perfect outcome.", "\"He reassured me his goal was to simply reduce the size of his chest to be more comfortable wearing t-shirts \u2026 and accepted the risk of loose skin both in writing and verbally,\" he said.", "", "
Watch the Four Corners investigation into the unregulated world of cosmetic surgery.
", "AHPRA has limited powers. It can caution a practitioner, make sure a practitioner can practise with restrictions or refer a complaint to another body but it does not have the power to order a practitioner to pay compensation, give a refund or apologise.", "A fact sheet sent to complainants last year said more than 70 per cent of matters closed with no action taken and fewer than 1 per cent of matters ended with a practitioner's registration being cancelled or suspended.", "In a statement, AHPRA said: \"Immediate action is taken when we consider a practitioner may pose a serious immediate risk to the public and we need to restrict or suspend their registration while we investigate.\"", "It said cancellation of registration was the most serious outcome available under the national law.", "\"Only a tribunal can cancel a practitioner's registration.\"", "Melbourne's Alfred Hospital reported Dr Lanzer and one of his nurses to AHPRA in August this year over alleged breaches of COVID-19 protocols and its own professional standards in regard to a patient who had presented to the hospital with a punctured abdomen and chest after a full body liposuction and tummy tuck at Dr Lanzer's clinic.", "Documents obtained under Freedom of Information laws revealed The Alfred made the official complaint after one of Dr Lanzer's nurses visited the patient without approval, changed her wound dressings and organised a telehealth conference with the patient and Dr Lanzer.", "The hospital told AHPRA it was concerned the nurse had contravened her professional code of conduct in the provision of care and that Dr Lanzer's practice \"is not consistent with good medicine practices as outlined \u2026\u00a0in the Code of Conduct for Doctors\".", "AHPRA said it could not comment on open investigations."]
